alert.note: Alert for Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 25 at 3:58AM PST until February 28 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Medford
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 4 PM PST SUNDAY... ...WINTER STORM WATCH IN EFFECT FROM LATE SUNDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE MONDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow expected. Total snow accumulations of 3 to 8 inches in the Siskiyou Mountains and 6 to 12 inches in the Southern Oregon Cascades. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Winter Storm Watch, heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 15 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 55 mph. * WHERE...South Central Oregon Cascades and Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades. This includes Crater Lake, Diamond Lake, Lake of the Woods, and Siskiyou Summit. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, from 1 AM to 4 PM PST Sunday. For the Winter Storm Watch, from late Sunday night through late Monday night. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches. * View the hazard area in detail at https://www.wrh.noaa.gov/map/?wfo=mfr
info.instruction: * Slow down and allow extra time to reach your destination. * Carry tire chains and be prepared for snow covered roads and limited visibilities. * See https://www.tripcheck.com for latest road conditions. * A Winter Weather Advisory for snow means that periods of snow will cause travel difficulties.

area.areaDesc: Siskiyou Mountains and Southern Oregon Cascades; South Central Oregon Cascades
